TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed MatchEvaluator extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: The object that represents a single regular expression match during a method operation.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that is called each time a regular expression match is found during a method operation.
Docs.returns: A string returned by the method that is represented by the MatchEvaluator delegate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use a MatchEvaluator delegate method to perform a custom verification or manipulation operation for each match found by a replacement method such as <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Replace%28System.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.MatchEvaluator%29?displayProperty=fullName>. For each matched string, the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Replace%2A> method calls the MatchEvaluator delegate method with a <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match> object that represents the match. The delegate method performs whatever processing you prefer and returns a string that the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Replace%2A> method substitutes for the matched string.
